alert.note: Alert for Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 7:44AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...BANDS OF SNOW MOVING ACROSS FAR WESTERN NEVADA THIS MORNING... * Bands of light to moderate snow will move across far western Nevada including the main urban areas from Reno-Sparks southward to Carson City, Virginia City and Minden this morning. * While most valley floors will see little to no accumulation with wet roads, areas near and above 5000 feet could receive up to 1 inch of new snowfall, with patchy slick and slushy travel conditions including US-395 north of Reno and I-580 between Reno and Carson City. * The heavier snow bands will reduce visibility to below 1 mile at times. Slow down and leave extra distance between vehicles when driving through the snow. * Most of the accumulating snow will end after 9 AM, with showers diminishing through the late morning.
